cpsc433

Class SearchControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • cpsc433.SearchControl

  • public class SearchControl
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as the search control for the search process, along with the summing of penalty points. Theoretical elements include fleaf and fselect. The f_leaf function takes in assignments and determines the penalty score of the scenario (node). The fselect function takes in child nodes, and returns the child node with the highest score.
    Author:
    Brandon Sieu

      static int f_leaf(Person[] people)
      Version of f_leaf to be called when the root node of the search tree is not empty (input file contains room assignments).
      static int f_leaf(Person personName, Person... people)
      Returns the total penalty associated with a state (partial or complete building assignment) by determining which soft constraints are violated.
      static ONode f_select(java.util.Vector children)
      Performs f_select and returns the child with the highest f_leaf value.

    • Method Detail

      • f_leaf

        public static int f_leaf(Person personName,
                         Person... people)
        Returns the total penalty associated with a state (partial or complete building assignment) by determining which soft constraints are violated.
        Parameters:
        personName - person to be inserted into the building assignment state
        people - existent people in the building assignment state
        Returns:
        penalty score of the building assignment

      • f_leaf

        public static int f_leaf(Person[] people)
        Version of f_leaf to be called when the root node of the search tree is not empty (input file contains room assignments).
        Parameters:
        people - the array of person objects that reside within the root node
        Returns:
        penalty score of the building assignment

      • f_select

        public static ONode f_select(java.util.Vector children)
        Performs f_select and returns the child with the highest f_leaf value.
        Parameters:
        children - the vector of children nodes.
        Returns:
        the child node with the best f_leaf value.
